name: Rice & Veggie Stir-Fry with Protein
description: A stir-fry made with rice, vegetables, and your choice of protein. It’s quick, customizable, and great for leftovers.

options.name: Rice
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the rice and a pinch of salt. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.

options.name: Quinoa
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh strainer.
Bring 2 cups of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.
Prepare the base ingredient following its specific instructions.
In a large skillet or wok, heat olive oil and sauté garlic and ginger if using.
Cook protein of choice until done. For eggs, scramble separately and set aside.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Stir in cooked base and gluten-free soy sauce. Mix thoroughly and serve.

name: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes with Beans and Veggies
description: Baked sweet potatoes filled with a savory mix of beans, vegetables, and optional toppings.
instructions: Bake sweet potatoes following their specific instructions.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté diced bell pepper until softened.
Add black beans, corn, salsa, and spices. Cook until warmed through.
Slice open the baked sweet potatoes and fill with the bean and veggie mixture.
Top with optional avocado or additional toppings if desired.

name: One-Pan Roasted Veggies & Chickpeas
description: A simple sheet-pan meal with roasted veggies and chickpeas, served over rice or greens.

options.name: Rice
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the rice and a pinch of salt. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.

options.name: Quinoa
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh strainer.
Bring 2 cups of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Spread chopped vegetables and chickpeas on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with spices, and toss to coat evenly.
Roast for 30-40 minutes, stirring halfway, until veggies are tender and slightly crispy.
Serve over prepared base or on its own.

name: Lentil & Veggie Stew
description: A hearty, comforting stew with lentils and vegetables, perfect for leftovers.

ingredients.name: Spices
ingredients.quantity: cumin, thyme, bay leaf, salt, pepper

instructions: Prepare lentils according to their specific instructions.
In a large pot, heat olive oil and sauté onions, celery, and carrots until softened.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and spices. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until lentils are tender.
Add quick-cooking greens in the last 10 minutes if desired. Adjust seasoning to taste and serve warm.
